main event: A red dot observed in a 35mm color slide photo was determined to be a perforation of one or two layers of emulsion, likely caused by a small rise with a pit at the center from a light source.
interesting points: The sighting occurred in Derby, Colorado on 20 October 1958, and it was a ground-visual observation lasting 2-3 minutes.
The observer, Mr. Harold C. Hodges, noticed a red dot in the picture which he had not noticed when he took the photo.
The document is related to Project Blue Book, a U.S. government program that investigated unidentified flying objects (UFOs).
The red dot in the center of the slide was determined by the ATIC photo lab to be a perforation of one or two layers of emulsion.
The 35mm color slide was returned to Mr. Derby, Colorado after observation by proper authorities.
sighted object: red dot in a 35mm color slide photo
